title: Hilary Duff looks boho chic as she joins fiance Matthew Koma and baby Banks for grocery outing in LA
text:
Hilary Duff is preparing to play Lizzie McGuire once again in the Disney+ revival, which will follow the now 30-year-old single woman in New York.

Meanwhile, the actress is enjoying her life as a 30-something engaged mom in Los Angeles.

She stepped out Sunday with fiancé Matthew Koma and daughter Banks for some grocery shopping in Studio City.

Grocery run: Hilary Duff stepped out Sunday with fiancé Matthew Koma and daughter Banks for some grocery shopping in Studio City

The 32-year-old looked boho chic in a wide-brimmed crimson fedora with a grey long-sleeve crop top with skinny black jeans.

Duff walked alongside Koma, 32, as she carried Banks, one, before sitting her in the shopping cart.

The mother-of-two took to Instagram Saturday, explaining how difficult it is to help son Luca with his second grade homework.

She explained that she left 'real' school in third grade, as she started tutoring on film and television sets.

Boho chic: The 32-year-old looked boho chic in a wide-brimmed crimson fedora with a grey long-sleeve crop top with skinny black jeans

Family outing: Duff walked alongside Koma, 32, as she carried Banks, one, before sitting her in the shopping cart

Duff wrote: 'This guy with his spirit and kindness. Homework is already no joke in 2nd grade.

'I stopped going to “real” school in 3rd grade so I’m actually doomed... I am left scratching my head alll the time looking at his homework and I’m terrified for next year!'

Duff posted a photo of herself and the seven-year-old looking perplexed over a homework assignment.

Early start: Duff's big break came at 10 years old when she played the titular witch in Casper Meets Wendy in 1998

Zoog Disney queen: She soon went on to lead her own Disney Channel show Lizzie McGuire, which ran from 2001 to 2004

She added: 'Although Singapore math is the s***....also learned a lot about tick birds this week. #rhinosbegrateful'

Duff's big break came at 10 years old when she played the titular witch in Casper Meets Wendy in 1998.

She soon went on to lead her own Disney Channel show Lizzie McGuire, which ran from 2001 to 2004.

The actress is revisiting the role for the upcoming Disney+ revival, which was recently announced.

Reboot: The actress is revisiting the role for the upcoming Disney+ revival, which was recently announced

New adventures: She told E! News of the revival: 'I have said this before, but for me coming back when she's 30 and she's not in a marriage and she's not having a baby and she's not doing all the things that I have already done in my life, that story is really exciting for me'

She told E! News of the revival: 'I have said this before, but for me coming back when she's 30 and she's not in a marriage and she's not having a baby and she's not doing all the things that I have already done in my life, that story is really exciting for me.

'I think to myself, where can we go? What are the struggles of a 30-year-old right now? What are the pressures that life throws in front of a woman who is 30 and doesn't have all the things yet?

'And for me, that's Lizzie McGuire, she had those struggles in middle school where she didn't have a place where she fits in and you know, always on the struggle bus, but she's also your best friend, and that's exactly what I want to target and hit home again—is being there for girls in this time of their life.'
